 26namespace vsip
 27{
 28
 29namespace impl
 30{
 31
 32/// Compute the size of a block distribution segement.
 33
 34/// Requires:
 35///   SIZE is the total number of elements
 36///   NUM is the number of segments
 37///   POS is the segment position (0 <= POS < NUM).
 38/// Returns:
 39///   The size of segment POS.
 40///
 41/// Notes:
 42///   If SIZE does not distribute evenly over NUM segments, then extra
 43///   elements are allocated to the first SIZE % NUM segments.
 44
 45inline length_type
 46segment_size(length_type size, length_type num, index_type pos)
 47{
 48#if VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE
 49  length_type segment = size / num;
 50  if (size % num == 0)
 51    return segment;
 52  else if (size < num)
 53    return (pos < size) ? 1 : 0;
 54  // else if (pos < num-1) return segment + 1;
 55  else if ((pos+1)*(segment+1) < size)
 56    return segment + 1;
 57  else
 58    return (size < pos*(segment+1)) ? 0 : size - pos*(segment+1);
 59#else
 60  return (size / num) + (pos < size % num ? 1 : 0);
 61#endif
 62}
 63
 64
 65
 66/// Compute the size of a block-cyclic distribution segement.
 67
 68/// Requires:
 69///   SIZE is the total number of elements,
 70///   NUM is the number of segments,
 71///   CHUNK_SIZE is the multiple which elements are grouped together,
 72///   POS is the segment position (0 <= POS < NUM).
 73/// Returns:
 74///   The size of segment POS.
 75///
 76/// Notes:
 77///   If SIZE does not distribute evenly over NUM segments,
 78///      then extra chunk are allocated to the first SIZE % NUM segments.
 79///   If SIZE does not distribute evenly into CHUNK_SIZE,
 80///      then the SIZE%
 81
 82inline length_type
 83segment_size(
 84  length_type size,
 85  length_type num,
 86  length_type chunk_size,
 87  index_type  pos)
 88{
 89  assert(pos < num);
 90
 91  // Compute the total number of chunks to be distributed.
 92  index_type  num_chunks = size / chunk_size + (size % chunk_size ? 1 : 0);
 93
 94  // Compute the number of chunks in segment POS.
 95  length_type seg_chunks = (num_chunks / num) +
 96                           (pos < num_chunks % num ? 1 : 0);
 97
 98  // Compute the number of elements in segment POS.
 99  length_type seg_size    = seg_chunks * chunk_size;
100
101  // Adjust number of elements if SIZE does not evenly distribute into
102  // CHUNK_SIZE.
103  if (size % chunk_size != 0 && (pos + 1) % num == (num_chunks % num))
104    seg_size = seg_size - chunk_size + size % chunk_size;
105
106  return seg_size;
107}
108
109
110
111/// Compute the size of a block-cyclic distribution segement in chunks.
112
113/// Requires:
114///   SIZE is the total number of elements,
115///   NUM is the number of segments,
116///   CHUNK_SIZE is the multiple which elements are grouped together,
117///   POS is the segment position (0 <= POS < NUM).
118/// Returns:
119///   The number of chunks in segment POS.
120///      (This may not equal the number of elements / CHUNK_SIZE, if
121///      SIZE does not evenly distribute into CHUNKS).
122///
123/// Notes:
124///   If SIZE does not distribute evenly over NUM segments,
125///      then extra chunk are allocated to the first SIZE % NUM segments.
126///   If SIZE does not distribute evenly into CHUNK_SIZE,
127///      then the SIZE%
128
129inline length_type
130segment_chunks(
131  length_type size,
132  length_type num,
133  length_type chunk_size,
134  index_type pos)
135{
136  assert(pos < num);
137
138  // Compute the total number of chunks to be distributed.
139  index_type  num_chunks = size / chunk_size + (size % chunk_size ? 1 : 0);
140
141  // Compute the number of chunks in segment POS.
142  length_type seg_chunks = (num_chunks / num) +
143                           (pos < num_chunks % num ? 1 : 0);
144
145  return seg_chunks;
146}
147
148
149
150/// Compute the size of a specific chunk in a block-cyclic
151/// distribution segment.
152
153/// Requires:
154///   SIZE is the total number of elements,
155///   NUM is the number of segments,
156///   CHUNK_SIZE is the multiple which elements are grouped together,
157///   SPOS is the segment position (0 <= SPOS < NUM).
158///   CPOS is the chunk position
159///      (0 <= CPOS < segment_chunks(SIZE, NUM, CHUNK_SIZE, POS)).
160/// Returns:
161///   The size of chunk CPOS in segment SPOS.
162///
163
164inline length_type
165segment_chunk_size(
166  length_type size,
167  length_type num,
168  length_type chunk_size,
169  index_type  spos,
170  index_type  cpos)
171{
172  assert(spos < num);
173
174  // Compute the total number of chunks to be distributed.
175  index_type  num_chunks = size / chunk_size + (size % chunk_size ? 1 : 0);
176
177  // Compute the number of chunks in segment POS.
178  length_type seg_chunks = (num_chunks / num) +
179                           (spos < num_chunks % num ? 1 : 0);
180
181  assert(cpos < seg_chunks);
182
183  if (size % chunk_size != 0 &&
184      (spos + 1) % num == (num_chunks % num) &&
185      cpos == seg_chunks-1)
186    return size % chunk_size;
187  else
188    return chunk_size;
189}
190
191
192
193/// Compute the first element in a segment.
194
195/// Requires:
196///   SIZE is the total number of elements,
197///   NUM is the number of segments,
198///   POS is the segment position (0 <= POS < NUM).
199/// Returns:
200///   The index of the first element in segment POS.
201
202inline length_type
203segment_start(
204  length_type size,
205  length_type num,
206  index_type  pos)
207{
208#if VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE
209  if (size % num == 0)
210    return pos * (size / num);
211  else
212    return pos * ((size / num) + 1);
213#else
214  return pos * (size / num) + std::min(pos, size % num);
215#endif
216}
217
218} // namespace impl
219
220} // namespace vsip
221
222/***********************************************************************
223  Class Definitions - Distributions
224***********************************************************************/
225
226namespace vsip
227{
228
229/// We define the following implementation specific member functions
230/// for distributions:
231///
232/// * impl_subblock_patches(DOM, SB) 
233///      returns the number of patches in subblock SB.
234///
235/// * impl_subblock_size(DOM, SB) 
236///      returns the number of elements in subblock SB.
237///
238/// * impl_patch_global_dom(DOM, SB, P) 
239///      returns the global domain of patch P in subblock SB.
240///
241/// * impl_patch_global_dom(DOM, SB, P) 
242///      returns the local domain of patch P in subblock SB.
243
244// Note: distribution_type defined in support.hpp.
245
246
247
248/// Whole Distribution.
249
250class Whole_dist
251{
252  // Constructors and destructor.
253public:
254  Whole_dist() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
255
256  // This constructor allows users to construct maps without having
257  // explicitly say 'Whole_dist()'.
258  Whole_dist(length_type n_sb) VSIP_NOTHROW { assert(n_sb == 1); }
259
260  ~Whole_dist() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
261  
262  // Default copy constructor and assignment are fine.
263
264  // Accessors
265public:
266  distribution_type distribution() const VSIP_NOTHROW
267    { return whole; }
268
269  index_type num_subblocks() const VSIP_NOTHROW
270    { return 1; }
271
272  length_type cyclic_contiguity() const VSIP_NOTHROW
273    { return 0; }
274
275  // Implementation specific.
276public:
277  length_type impl_subblock_patches(Domain<1> const&, index_type sb)
278    const VSIP_NOTHROW
279  { assert(sb == 0); return 1; }
280
281  length_type impl_subblock_size(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb)
282    const VSIP_NOTHROW
283  { assert(sb == 0); return dom.size(); }
284
285  Domain<1> impl_patch_global_dom(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb,
286				  index_type p)
287    const VSIP_NOTHROW
288  { assert(sb == 0 && p == 0); return dom; }
289
290  Domain<1> impl_patch_local_dom(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb,
291				 index_type p)
292    const VSIP_NOTHROW
293  { assert(sb == 0 && p == 0); return dom; }
294
295  index_type impl_subblock_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
296    const VSIP_NOTHROW
297  { assert(i < dom.size()); return 0; }
298
299  index_type impl_patch_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
300    const VSIP_NOTHROW
301  { assert(i < dom.size()); return 0; }
302
303  index_type impl_local_from_global_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
304    const VSIP_NOTHROW
305  { assert(i < dom.size()); return i; }
306
307  index_type impl_global_from_local_index(Domain<1> const& dom,
308					  index_type       sb,
309					  index_type       i)
310    const VSIP_NOTHROW
311  { assert(i < dom.size() && sb == 0); return i; }
312
313  // No member data.
314};
315
316
317
318/// Block Distribution.
319
320class Block_dist
321{
322  // Constructors and destructor.
323public:
324  Block_dist(length_type num_subblocks = 1) VSIP_NOTHROW;
325  ~Block_dist() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
326  
327  // Default copy constructor and assignment are fine.
328
329  // Accessors
330public:
331  distribution_type distribution() const VSIP_NOTHROW
332    { return block; }
333
334  index_type num_subblocks() const VSIP_NOTHROW
335    { return num_subblocks_; }
336
337  length_type cyclic_contiguity() const VSIP_NOTHROW
338    { return 0; }
339
340  // Implementation specific.
341public:
342  length_type impl_subblock_patches(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb)
343    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
344
345  length_type impl_subblock_size(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb)
346    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
347
348  Domain<1> impl_patch_global_dom(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb,
349				  index_type p)
350    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
351
352  Domain<1> impl_patch_local_dom(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb,
353				 index_type p)
354    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
355
356  index_type impl_subblock_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
357    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
358
359  index_type impl_patch_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
360    const VSIP_NOTHROW
361  { assert(i < dom.size()); return 0; }
362
363  index_type impl_local_from_global_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
364    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
365
366  index_type impl_global_from_local_index(Domain<1> const& dom,
367					  index_type       sb,
368					  index_type       i)
369    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
370
371  // Member data.
372private:
373  length_type num_subblocks_;
374};

380class Cyclic_dist
381{
382  // Constructors, assignment, and destructor.
383public:
384  Cyclic_dist(length_type num_subblocks = 1, length_type contiguity = 1)
385    VSIP_NOTHROW;

387
388  // Default copy constructor and assignment are fine.
389
390  // Accessors
391public:
392  distribution_type distribution() const VSIP_NOTHROW
393    { return cyclic; }
394
395  index_type num_subblocks() const VSIP_NOTHROW
396    { return num_subblocks_; }
397
398  length_type cyclic_contiguity() const VSIP_NOTHROW
399    { return contiguity_; }
400
401  // Implementation specific functions.
402public:
403  length_type impl_subblock_patches(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb)
404    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
405
406  length_type impl_subblock_size(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb)
407    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
408
409  Domain<1> impl_patch_global_dom(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb,
410				  index_type p)
411    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
412
413  Domain<1> impl_patch_local_dom(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type sb,
414				 index_type p)
415    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
416
417  index_type impl_subblock_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
418    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
419
420  index_type impl_patch_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
421    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
422
423  index_type impl_local_from_global_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
424    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
425
426  index_type impl_global_from_local_index(Domain<1> const& dom,
427					  index_type       sb,
428					  index_type       i)
429    const VSIP_NOTHROW;
430
431  // Members
432private:
433  length_type num_subblocks_;
434  length_type contiguity_;
435};

437
438
439/***********************************************************************
440  Definitions
441***********************************************************************/
442
443// Block_dist
444
445/// Create a block distribution.
446
447/// Requires:
448///   NUM_SUBBLOCKS is number of subblocks in distribution
449///      (NUM_SUBBLOCKS > 0).
450inline
451Block_dist::Block_dist(
452  length_type num_subblocks)
453  VSIP_NOTHROW
454: num_subblocks_(num_subblocks)
455{
456  assert(num_subblocks_ > 0);
457}
458
459
460
461inline length_type
462Block_dist::impl_subblock_patches(Domain<1> const& /*dom*/, index_type sb)
463  const VSIP_NOTHROW
464{
465  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
466  return 1;
467}
468
469
470
471inline length_type
472Block_dist::impl_subblock_size(
473  Domain<1> const& dom,
474  index_type       sb)
475  const VSIP_NOTHROW
476{
477  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
478  return impl::segment_size(dom.length(), num_subblocks_, sb);
479}
480
481
482
483inline Domain<1>
484Block_dist::impl_patch_global_dom(
485  Domain<1> const& dom,
486  index_type       sb,
487  index_type       p)
488  const VSIP_NOTHROW
489{
490  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
491  assert(p == 0);
492  return Domain<1>(impl::segment_start(dom.length(), num_subblocks_, sb),
493		   1,
494		   impl::segment_size(dom.length(), num_subblocks_, sb));
495}
496
497
498
499inline Domain<1>
500Block_dist::impl_patch_local_dom(
501  Domain<1> const& dom,
502  index_type       sb,
503  index_type       p)
504  const VSIP_NOTHROW
505{
506  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
507  assert(p == 0);
508  return Domain<1>(0,
509		   1,
510		   impl::segment_size(dom.length(), num_subblocks_, sb));
511}
512
513
514
515// The nominal_block_size is roughly the total number of elements
516// divided by the number of subblocks.  If this divides evenly, it
517// is the exact block size, however if the number does not divide
518// cleanly, then the remaining elements (called the "spill_over")
519// are distributed 1 each to first subblocks.
520
521inline index_type
522Block_dist::impl_subblock_from_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
523  const VSIP_NOTHROW
524{
525#if VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE
526  length_type nominal_block_size = dom.length() / num_subblocks_
527    + (dom.length() % num_subblocks_ == 0 ? 0 : 1);
528
529  return i / nominal_block_size;
530#else
531  length_type nominal_block_size = dom.length() / num_subblocks_;
532  length_type spill_over         = dom.length() % num_subblocks_;
533
534  if (i < (nominal_block_size+1)*spill_over)
535    return i / (nominal_block_size+1);
536  else
537    return (i - spill_over) / nominal_block_size;
538#endif
539}
540
541
542
543inline index_type
544Block_dist::impl_local_from_global_index(Domain<1> const& dom, index_type i)
545  const VSIP_NOTHROW
546{
547#if VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE
548  length_type nominal_block_size = dom.length() / num_subblocks_;
549
550  if (dom.length() % num_subblocks_ == 0)
551    // all blocks are same size
552    return i % (nominal_block_size);
553  else
554    // all blocks are same size, except last one
555    return i % (nominal_block_size+1);
556#else
557  length_type nominal_block_size = dom.length() / num_subblocks_;
558  length_type spill_over         = dom.length() % num_subblocks_;
559
560  if (i < (nominal_block_size+1)*spill_over)
561    return i % (nominal_block_size+1);
562  else
563    return (i - spill_over) % nominal_block_size;
564#endif
565}
566
567
568
569/// Determine the global index corresponding to a local subblock index
570
571/// Requires:
572///   DOM is the full global domain,
573///   SB is a valid subblock (SB < number of subblocks).
574///   I  is an index into the subblock.
575/// Returns:
576
577inline index_type
578Block_dist::impl_global_from_local_index(
579  Domain<1> const& dom,
580  index_type       sb,
581  index_type       i)
582const VSIP_NOTHROW
583{
584#if VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE
585  length_type nominal_block_size = dom.length() / num_subblocks_;
586  if (dom.length() % num_subblocks_ == 0)
587    return sb * nominal_block_size + i;
588  else
589    return sb * (nominal_block_size+1) + i;
590#else
591  length_type nominal_block_size = dom.length() / num_subblocks_;
592  length_type spill_over         = dom.length() % num_subblocks_;
593
594  return sb * nominal_block_size  +
595         std::min(sb, spill_over) +
596         i;
597#endif
598}
599
600
601
602// -------------------------------------------------------------------- //
603// Cyclic_dist
604
605/// Create a block-cyclic distribution.
606
607/// Requires:
608///   NUM_SUBBLOCKS is number of subblocks in distribution
609///      (NUM_SUBBLOCKS > 0).
610///   CONTIGUITY is cyclic contiguity of the distribution
611///      (CONTIGUITY > 0).
612
613inline
614Cyclic_dist::Cyclic_dist(
615  length_type num_subblocks,
616  length_type contiguity)
617VSIP_NOTHROW
618: num_subblocks_(num_subblocks),
619  contiguity_   (contiguity)
620{
621  assert(num_subblocks_ > 0 && contiguity_ > 0);
622}
623
624
625
626/// Get the number of patches in a subblock.
627
628/// Requires:
629///   DOM is the full global domain,
630///   SB is a valid subblock (SB < number of subblocks).
631/// Returns:
632///   The number of patches in subblock SB.
633
634inline length_type
635Cyclic_dist::impl_subblock_patches(
636  Domain<1> const& dom,
637  index_type       sb)
638  const VSIP_NOTHROW
639{
640  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
641  return impl::segment_chunks(dom.length(), num_subblocks_, contiguity_, sb);
642}
643
644
645
646/// Get the number of elements in a subblock.
647
648/// Requires:
649///   DOM is the full global domain,
650///   SB is a valid subblock (SB < number of subblocks).
651/// Returns:
652///   The number of elements in subblock SB.
653
654inline length_type
655Cyclic_dist::impl_subblock_size(
656  Domain<1> const& dom,
657  index_type       sb)
658  const VSIP_NOTHROW
659{
660  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
661  return impl::segment_size(dom.length(), num_subblocks_, contiguity_, sb);
662}
663
664
665
666/// Get the global domain of a subblock/patch.
667
668/// Requires:
669///   DOM is the full global domain,
670///   SB is a valid subblock (SB < number of subblocks).
671///   P  is a valid patch in subblock SB.
672/// Returns:
673///   The global domain of patch P in subblock SB.
674
675inline Domain<1>
676Cyclic_dist::impl_patch_global_dom(
677  Domain<1> const& dom,
678  index_type       sb,
679  index_type       p)
680  const VSIP_NOTHROW
681{
682  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
683  assert(p < impl_subblock_patches(dom, sb));
684
685  length_type patch_size = impl::segment_chunk_size(
686    dom.length(), num_subblocks_, contiguity_, sb, p);
687
688  return Domain<1>((sb + p*num_subblocks_)*contiguity_,
689		   1,
690		   patch_size);
691}
692
693
694
695/// Get the local domain of a subblock/patch.
696
697/// Requires:
698///   DOM is the full global domain,
699///   SB is a valid subblock (SB < number of subblocks).
700///   P  is a valid patch in subblock SB.
701/// Returns:
702///   The local domain of patch P in subblock SB.
703
704inline Domain<1>
705Cyclic_dist::impl_patch_local_dom(
706  Domain<1> const& dom,
707  index_type       sb,
708  index_type       p)
709  const VSIP_NOTHROW
710{
711  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
712  assert(p < impl_subblock_patches(dom, sb));
713
714  length_type patch_size = impl::segment_chunk_size(
715    dom.length(), num_subblocks_, contiguity_, sb, p);
716
717  return Domain<1>(p*contiguity_,
718		   1,
719		   patch_size);
720}
721
722
723
724inline index_type
725Cyclic_dist::impl_subblock_from_index(
726  Domain<1> const& /*dom*/,
727  index_type       i)
728  const VSIP_NOTHROW
729{
730  // Determine global_patch containing index i.
731  index_type p_g      = i / contiguity_;
732
733  // Determine subblock holding this patch.
734  index_type sb  = p_g % num_subblocks_;
735
736  return sb;
737}
738
739
740
741inline index_type
742Cyclic_dist::impl_patch_from_index(
743  Domain<1> const& /*dom*/,
744  index_type       i)
745  const VSIP_NOTHROW
746{
747  // Determine global_patch containing index i.
748  index_type p_g      = i / contiguity_;
749
750  // Determine subblock holding this patch.
751  index_type sb  = p_g % num_subblocks_;
752  index_type p_l = (p_g - sb) / num_subblocks_;
753
754  return p_l;
755}
756
757
758
759inline index_type
760Cyclic_dist::impl_local_from_global_index(
761  Domain<1> const& /*dom*/,
762  index_type       i)
763  const VSIP_NOTHROW
764{
765  // Determine global_patch containing index i at offset.
766  index_type p_g      = i / contiguity_;
767  index_type p_offset = i % contiguity_;
768
769  // Convert this global patch to a subblock-patch.
770  index_type sb  = p_g % num_subblocks_;
771  index_type p_l = (p_g - sb) / num_subblocks_;
772
773  return p_l * contiguity_ + p_offset;
774}
775
776
777
778/// Determine the global index corresponding to a local subblock index
779
780/// Requires:
781///   DOM is the full global domain,
782///   SB is a valid subblock (SB < number of subblocks).
783///   I  is an index into the subblock.
784/// Returns:
785///   The global index corresponding to subblock SB index I.
786
787inline index_type
788Cyclic_dist::impl_global_from_local_index(
789  Domain<1> const& /*dom*/,
790  index_type       sb,
791  index_type       i)
792const VSIP_NOTHROW
793{
794  assert(sb < num_subblocks_);
795
796  index_type p        = i / contiguity_;
797  index_type p_offset = i % contiguity_;
798
799  return (p * num_subblocks_ + sb) * contiguity_ + p_offset;
800}
801
802} // namespace vsip
803
804#endif // VSIP_DIST_HPP
